vehicles.description: In the same lane ahead, there is a blue car at a moderate distance that appears to be moving in the same direction as our vehicle.
vehicles.explanation: The existence and behavior of this vehicle are crucial, as they determine the following distance and speed of our vehicle. Our vehicle must be ready at all times to respond to any sudden stops or turns.

vulnerable_road_users.description: An adult male pedestrian walks close to parked cars on the street, carrying a plastic bag and facing his own vehicle as he proceeds to the right side of the image.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: He is walking on the roadway rather than the sidewalk, and stepping further into the middle of the road could pose a potential risk.

other objects.description: On the right side of the street, a few scooters and a delivery electric bicycle with a cargo box are parked, partially obstructing the sidewalk.
other objects.explanation: These objects have reduced the available space for pedestrians on the sidewalk, which may be the reason why pedestrians walk on the road.

other objects.description: On the right-hand sidewalk, there are various objects, such as trash bins and delivery boxes, which may obscure potential hazards, like additional scooters or pedestrians stepping onto the street.
other objects.explanation: Obstacles on the sidewalk should make autonomous vehicles proceed with caution and be aware of potential unexpected movements in that area.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the observed image, there are various road users and objects, categorized as follows:

Vehicles:
There is a blue car in the same lane ahead of our vehicle, moving in the same direction at a moderate distance. It is essential to keep a safe following distance and adjust the speed of our vehicle accordingly, considering that the blue car's activities could directly influence our driving strategy. Our vehicle needs to remain alert for any abrupt changes in speed or direction from the blue car.

Vulnerable Road Users:
An adult male pedestrian is notable for walking near parked cars on the street. Carrying a plastic bag, this individual is headed toward the right side of the image. The pedestrianâ€™s choice to walk on the road rather than the sidewalk can be a potential hazard. The autonomous vehicle must monitor his movements carefully since an unexpected entry into the traffic lane could pose a threat to safety.

Other Objects:
On the right side of the street, scooters and an electric delivery bicycle with a cargo box have been parked, partially blocking the sidewalk. The consequence of these parked items is the narrowing of pedestrian space, possibly causing individuals to walk on the street, which requires additional attention from our autonomous vehicle.

Additionally, multiple objects, including trash bins and delivery boxes, are present on the right-hand sidewalk. These objects can conceal potential dangers, such as more scooters or pedestrians suddenly entering the street. As a result, an autonomous vehicle has to proceed with heightened caution in this area, being prepared for any unforeseen movements.

There are no traffic signs, traffic lights, traffic cones, or barriers present in the image, so no actions or considerations related to these categories are necessary.

driving_suggestion: Drive carefully, maintain a low speed, and be prepared to stop at any moment in case pedestrians decide to cross the road or move further into the lane. If possible, slightly turn to the left while ensuring your vehicle stays within its own lane without crossing into the oncoming traffic lane, leaving ample space for pedestrians. Also, be aware of other vehicles that may pull out from parking spaces. Keep a safe distance from the blue car ahead, watching for any changes in its speed or direction. Stay alert for pedestrians on the right, ensuring they are not endangered by your vehicle's movements. Be prepared to make lateral evasive maneuvers within your lane to avoid motorcycle obstacles, while making sure your vehicle does not encroach on the opposite lane or collide with pedestrians. Drive cautiously and always be ready to respond to the sudden actions of pedestrians or other vehicles. The vehicle should also maintain a safe distance from the cars parked on the right to prevent accidents if car doors suddenly open or if there's movement. It is advised to closely monitor pedestrians and be prepared in case they step onto the road. In summary, in this urban environment with potential unpredictable elements, it is recommended to adopt a defensive driving strategy, being ready to stop or slow down at any time.

2.description and explanation: This is a moped parked on the side of the road. Since it is stationary, the ego car can continue driving past it while maintaining a safe distance to prevent accidental contact, should the moped's owner return and start to move it.
